embeds.title: Quantum Chamber
embeds.description:
Special Relic / The Guardian / Downfall

Upon pickup, choose a card. Start each combat with this card removed from your deck. At the start of your 4th turn, return it and 2 copies of it to your hand.
*You get the chicken by hatching the egg, not by smashing it.*

embeds.title: Aged
embeds.description:
Curse / Downfall

**Unplayable**. **Ethereal**.
At the end of your turn, add a Void to the top of your draw pile.

embeds.title: Pain
embeds.description:
Curse / Slay the Spire

**Unplayable**.
While in hand,
lose 1 HP whenever you play another card.

super busted event, I have yet to lose a run where I got this event in. The copied cards keep all of the gems, which lets you do silly things like having 3 exploit gems with quarts to go infinite on turn 4. Or getting 3 packages, which can offer you 9+ upgraded cards in the middle of your turn; even with the RNG your still going to get a good turn no matter what with so many cards.
I have yet to elect to smash this, but I guess its nice for the option to exist
pain is a huge curse for 10% max hp gain
Part of me thinks that the curses should be switched around
I would never take a strawberry for a pain
the curses can't be switched, they're too thematic this way 😔

If you aren't already infinite, Use, on your Exploit Gems, Quartzed Temporal Strike, or Suspension+, will often give you an infinite (albeit one that can't go off before turn 4). Using this on an Exploit Gems was actually what made me first start looking for (and finding) Guardian infinites! Probably most of the time you already have one by Act 3, but if you don't,  this can bail you out. I probably take Use 20% of the time.

I take Smash 0% of the time and I can't imagine why anyone ever would. I guess an Omomori charge with no other use? Maybe if you are really drunk and bought a Prismatic Shard and took 2 Ruptures?
2 ruptures?
1 rupture should be enough
<rupture>

embeds.title: Rupture
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :red_energy: / The Ironclad / Slay the Spire

Whenever you lose HP from a card,
gain 1 (2) **Strength** :p_strength:.

messages.content: well 1 rupture+
we now know your start of darkness
lol get a few copies of twin slam

This event is usually run winning, and also very fun. The options here are very uneven, and it's hard to think of any situation where it would be correct to pick the second option. Getting quantum chamber is very powerful, it's a little bit on the slow side, but guardian is naturally good at stalling fights out and defending themselves, so having to wait until turn 4 is not that big of a deal. Guaranteeing that you get a specific card on turn 4, as well as 2 extra copies of it, gives you a ton of consistency, and can let you multiply all kinds of powerful effects. Socketed cards are great choices, with suspension+, temporal strike, prismatic spray, prismatic barrier, bauble burst, exploit gems, onyx, citrine, quartz, amber, ruby, and emerald all providing great value when multiplied, and several of those can create infinites or create substantial amounts of strength/dex scaling. 

Other fun targets include time capacitor, incinerate+, clone, floating orbs, compile package+, speed boost, time sifter, stasis field, and revenge protocol+. If you have a mummified hand, you can do some really goofy stuff with powers to scale out of control, with stasis engine being particularly silly and ambitious, and construction form+ can be strong just to speed up the scaling and provide more buffer stacks. Bird faced urn can be used to heal for 6 every fight if you choose a power as well.

In order to stay safe while waiting for this to go off on turn 4, you want to include a bit more front-loading than normal, taking some extra defensive cards particularly. Relics can help a lot, all of the boat relics and guardian gear are excellent with quantum chamber, any sustain relics are too, especially meat on the bone. Orb support and spheric shield can both help you in shorter fights while quantum chamber provides the scaling you need for longer fights. Repulsor is a great way to mitigate the aged, and also is naturally very helpful against both act 4 fights.
